meanings.definition: To produce a picture or diagram by making lines and marks on paper.
meanings.sent1: I will draw a flower on the paper.
meanings.sent2: She likes to draw animals in her sketchbook.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried to draw a smiley face but it looked like a potato.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a paintbrush, drawing a vivid picture in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hand moved swiftly to draw a beautiful landscape.

meanings.definition: To pull or drag something in a particular direction.
meanings.sent2: He had to draw the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The magnet seemed to draw the metal objects towards it magically.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind seemed to draw the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The tractor struggled to draw the plow through the tough soil.

meanings.definition: To attract or pull towards oneself.
meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked cookies will draw people to the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: Her charisma always seems to draw a crowd around her.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious treasure map seemed to draw the adventurers into the unknown.
meanings.sent4: His infectious laughter could draw a smile from even the grumpiest person.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon sign outside the store drew customers in like moths to a flame.

meanings.definition: To bring out a weapon for use.
meanings.sent1: The knight had to draw his sword to defend the castle.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy was quick to draw his gun in the showdown.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the hero would always dramatically draw his weapon at the last moment.
meanings.sent4: The detective slowly drew his gun as he entered the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The samurai's swift draw of the katana was unmatched in the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To finish a game or competition with neither side winning.
meanings.sent1: The chess match ended in a draw after a long battle.
meanings.sent2: The soccer game resulted in a draw with both teams scoring equally.
meanings.sent3: The siblings decided to draw in their game of tic-tac-toe.
meanings.sent4: The debate ended in a draw as both speakers presented strong arguments.
meanings.sent5: The final round of the tournament ended in a draw, surprising everyone.
